text: Sun at the 2013 World Championships in Athletics Sun Huanhuan (; born 15 March 1990) is a Chinese female racewalking athlete who competes in the 20 kilometres race walk event.Sun Huanhuan. All Athletics. Retrieved on 2016-07-31. She was fourth at the World Championships in Athletics in 2013. She first began competing in 2007 but it was not until 2013 that she received her first international call-up. A member of the People's Army, she entered her first international event at the Taicang leg of the 2013 IAAF Race Walking Challenge. She surprised by winning the competition, beating Olympic medallist Qieyang Shenjie among others.Jalava, Mirko (2013-03-01). Li and Sun upset the favourites in Taicang. IAAF. Retrieved on 2016-07-31. Two months later she competed at the 2013 Chinese National Games, but could only managed fifth in a quick contest (Lü Xiuzhi was the winner).Jalava, Mirko (2013-05-12). Wang, Wu and Lu the winners at China's National Games walks. IAAF. Retrieved on 2016-07-31. At the 2013 World Championships in Athletics she placed fourth behind compatriot Liu Hong. The winner, Russia's Elena Lashmanova was disqualified for doping the following year, but her medal stood.Landells, Steve (2013-08-13). Report: Women's 20km Race Walk – Moscow 2013. IAAF. Retrieved on 2016-07-31. Sun was part of China's silver medal-winning team at the 2014 IAAF World Race Walking Cup, taking 20th individually.Huanhuan Sun. IAAF. Retrieved on 2016-07-31. She missed national selection in 2015 and 2016, with her most notable result in the period being third in Taicang on the 2015 IAAF Race Walking Challenge.Chen and Duan continue China's race walking dominance in Taicang. IAAF (2015-05-01).
